contentBlocks.plain_text: Project overview

Over the course of three mouths I undertook research, benchmark analysis and concept design responsibilities, to clarify: What factors constitute the Latin American gaming ecosystem? / How does a non-gaming brand can engage with this audience? / How does food consumption is related with gaming?
Key findings
There is a lot to talk about what I learned from this research, so let us dive deeper into some of my most interesting findings:

The concept of non-endemic brands accounts for companies not related to gaming: They seek to engage with gamers through well-known strategies like advergames, in-game advertising, or sponsorship (KFC being a top player). However, an underlying formula is needed to increase the chances of getting a positive response from the demanding gaming audience. I coined the strategy "The gaming formula" = EP + CC + EP *endemic partner + communication channel + enabler platform.

Food and gaming have a counterintuitive relationship: Since most dedicated gamers have high-end devices, there isn't much room for oily food, beverages, and food crumbs near their gaming area. Even when sweetened drinks are common for boosting energy among regular gamers. Interestingly, non-endemic food brands seek to enable connections and interactions between people through gaming-related initiatives instead of pairing the consumption and gaming moment together.
Concept delivery

We developed and presented several concepts to Coca-Cola, leveraging our previous learnings. Then, we selected the best concept that enabled connections and interactions between people through a gaming-related digital initiative.
While the strategy team focused on the marketing and business definitions, I was responsible for designing and bringing to life the user experience for the final demo.

Wrapping up phase 1

Phase 1 concluded with a comprehensive market report, insights discovery, and conceptual proposal, which we developed more deeply in Phase 2. It does not happen every day that you get to work on such exciting topics, and I feel fortunate because this project made me fall in love with video games again.

contentBlocks.plain_text: The solution
We delivered a end-to-end digital user experience, condensed in a mobile-first web app, that allowed The Coca-Cola Company to test their business hypothesis.

This collaborative effort culminated in a comprehensive handoff carried out in Figma. The handoff included a design system, visual guidelines for implementing banners, and detailed prototypes and wireframes to communicate the initiative's details. Additionally, we included a detailed roadmap with an implementation plan developed to facilitate the initiative's expansion across Latin America.
Hand-off to development

At the final stage, I structured the handoff file system for development, guiding a fellow designer to elaborate a detailed documentation of interactions and user flows. As a creative technologist, I encourage designers to think of applications as data manipulation tools that transform information through time. In that way, we built consistent systems of user flows that were feasible for development.
